intro: Psychotria sororia, commonly known as the "White Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a distinctive red calyx. It typically grows as an understory plant in tropical rainforests, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Psychotria sororia is also noted for its morphological similarities to other species in the genus, which can make identification challenging without careful examination.
